caption:
This photograph captures a lively interaction among a group of young African American individuals, presumably in an urban setting. In the image, several people are gathered closely, engaged in an animated conversation. There are seven visible individuals whose expressions and gestures suggest an enjoyable and possibly humorous discussion.

Starting from the left, a young man appears to be smiling or laughing as he leans forward slightly, engaging with a woman standing next to him who is mid-speech, as indicated by her open mouth and expressive hand gestures. She is dressed in a brown suede jacket and her hair styled away from her face. Next to her, a woman in a blue and white patterned headscarf is looking towards another central figure, a young woman who is the focus of the image. This central young woman, wearing a blue headscarf and a necklace with colorful beads, is smiling broadly and seems to be in the middle of explaining or recounting something, judging by her expressive hand movements.

On the right side of the picture, a woman wearing a plaid cap and holding what appears to be a rolled-up item listens intently. Beside her, only the back of another person's head is visible, clad in a white headscarf.

The setting suggests a casual outdoor gathering, perhaps on a street or in a public area given the hint of architecture and other indistinct figures in the background. The clothing styles suggest a period setting, possibly in the 1970s, based on the fashion elements like suede, headscarves, and the general style of jackets and shirts. The overall mood is convivial and expressive, typical of a warm and friendly group interaction.
title: At the George Westinghouse High School. (From the Sites exhibition. See also this fiche, row 3A.)
